ground_truth: A convertible smashes into a chasing police car, which is drawn alongside, then heads straight for Peter. Peter leaps in the air over the convertible, completes a backwards somersault, and lands, poised. The car chase is still on. One of the guys in the convertible pumps a shotgun. The leading police car spins. The second hits it. The third swerves to avoid it. It catapults into the air and drops towards a group of bystanders. It stops, suspended above them. Cowering, they all look closely at the squad car seemingly hanging in midair. It's caught in a web. Spider-Man swings past. Spider-Man slips between the cab and trailer of a truck as he pursues the convertible. Spider-Man soars, dives, and weaves to avoid the bullets being pumped directly at him. He fires two web pulls. He lands on the car's boot. He ensnares the men's weapons in their hands and tosses them over an overhead light, the men still attached. On stage, MJ stares at Peter's empty seat. Peter screeches up to the theater in the convertible. Peter leaves the car, then enters the theater. Peter bends down to tie his shoelace, watched by the usher, then straightens up. His tie is crooked. The usher in a waistcoat and dicky bow points to his tie. Peter straightens his necktie, then steps forward. He produces the ticket. The usher folds his arms. Peter walks to the door, then turns back. The usher gestures, locking his mouth. Peter looks at his ticket and glares at him. Peter sits on a stoop opposite the theater. A nearby street musician plays. Peter watches her, then closes his eyes and shakes his head incredulously. He steps forward, watching expectantly. MJ comes out through the stage door. A girl comes out after her. Peter smiles contentedly. Peter's smile fades as he sees the guy kissing MJ. Peter watches a police car fly past, followed by a few more. His attention returns to MJ. Then he looks down sadly and moves off. MJ and her man walk off, arm-in-arm. MJ looks around briefly as if expecting to see Peter, but there's nobody there. Peter enters a steam-filled backstreet. He breaks into a run, then tears open his shirt to reveal the Spider-Man costume. He pulls on the red mask, leaps into the air, casting a web line to pull himself up. Later, a group of squad cars weave their way down a wide city street. Above them, Spider-Man swings from building to building. Hanging mid-swing, he flicks his wrists. He falls 10 stories, landing on some metal. He hauls himself up from the now dented pipe. He takes off his Spider-Man mask and examines his wrist.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A cabriolet crashes into a pursuing patrol vehicle, which is drawn alongside, then heads directly for Peter. Peter vaults in the air over the cabriolet, performs a backward somersault, and lands, poised. The vehicle pursuit is still on. One of the guys in the cabriolet pumps a shotgun. The leading patrol vehicle spins. The second collides with it. The third veers to avoid it. It catapults into the air and descends towards a group of bystanders. It stops, suspended above them. Cowering, they all look closely at the squad car seemingly hanging in midair. It's caught in a web. Spider-Man swings past. Spider-Man slips between the cab and trailer of a lorry as he pursues the cabriolet. Spider-Man soars, dives, and weaves to avoid the projectiles being fired directly at him. He fires two web pulls. He lands on the vehicle's boot. He ensnares the men's arms in their hands and tosses them over an overhead light, the men still attached. On stage, MJ stares at Peter's vacant seat. Peter screeches up to the theater in the cabriolet. Peter departs the vehicle, then enters the theater. Peter bends down to tie his shoelace, watched by the usher, then straightens up. His tie is crooked. The usher in a waistcoat and dicky bow points to his tie. Peter straightens his necktie, then steps forward. He produces the ticket. The usher folds his arms. Peter walks to the door, then turns back. The usher gestures, locking his mouth. Peter looks at his ticket and glares at him. Peter sits on a stoop opposite the theater. A nearby street musician plays. Peter watches her, then closes his eyes and shakes his head incredulously. He steps forward, watching expectantly. MJ comes out through the stage door. A girl comes out after her. Peter beams contentedly. Peter's beam fades as he sees the guy kissing MJ. Peter watches a patrol vehicle fly past, followed by a few more. His attention returns to MJ. Then he looks down sadly and moves off. MJ and her man walk off, arm-in-arm. MJ looks around briefly as if expecting to see Peter, but there's nobody there. Peter enters a steam-filled backstreet. He breaks into a run, then tears open his shirt to reveal the Spider-Man costume. He pulls on the red mask, vaults into the air, casting a web line to elevate himself. Later, a group of squad cars weave their way down a wide city avenue. Above them, Spider-Man swings from edifice to edifice. Hanging mid-swing, he flicks his wrists. He falls 10 stories, landing on some metal. He hauls himself up from the now dented pipe. He takes off his Spider-Man mask and examines his wrist.

He falls 10 stories, landing on some metal. He hauls himself up from the now dented pipe. The Spider-Man mask is taken off by him and his wrist is examined by Peter.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A convertible collides with a police car, then heads straight for Peter, who leaps over it, completing a backward somersault. The chase continues. A convertible passenger fires a shotgun. The lead police car spins, the second crashes into it, and the third swerves, catapulting into the air toward bystanders. It's suspended by a web as Spider-Man swings by. Spider-Man maneuvers between truck parts, dodging bullets, and lands on the convertible's trunk. He webs the men's weapons, leaving them hanging attached to an overhead light. MJ notices Peter's absence at the theater. Peter arrives in the convertible, enters, and straightens his tie after a prompt from the usher. He presents his ticket, but the usher gestures silently. Peter glares, then sits outside watching a musician. MJ exits the theater, followed by a girl. Peter smiles, but it fades as MJ kisses another guy. Police cars rush past, but his focus remains on MJ. Left alone, Peter enters a steam-filled alley, dons his Spider-Man costume, and swings away. Later, Spider-Man swings above squad cars, falls 10 stories onto metal, then removes his mask and inspects his wrist.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A convertible crashes into a police car and heads for Peter. He leaps over it, somersaults, and lands poised. The chase continues. A convertible occupant pumps a shotgun, causing the leading police car to spin, hit another, and swerve into the air. It hovers above bystanders, trapped in a web. Spider-Man swings past, slipping through a truck to pursue the convertible. Avoiding bullets, he fires webs and lands on the trunk, ensnaring the men's weapons and hanging them overhead. At the theater, MJ notices Peter's empty seat. Peter parks the convertible, enters the theater, adjusts his crooked tie, and shows his ticket to the unimpressed usher. He sits outside, watching a street musician. MJ emerges, followed by a man who kisses her. Peter's smile fades. Distracted by passing police cars, he looks down sadly as MJ and the man leave. MJ glances back but doesn’t see Peter. Peter runs into a backstreet, revealing his Spider-Man costume and swings away. Later, squad cars move below as Spider-Man swings through the city, falls 10 stories, and climbs from a dented pipe to inspect his wrist without the mask.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: In a heart-pounding sequence of events, a sleek convertible smashes into a pursuing police car that has been drawn up alongside it. Without missing a beat, the convertible sets its course directly towards Peter. With remarkable agility, Peter leaps dramatically into the air, soaring over the convertible and executing a flawless backwards somersault before landing gracefully, composed and ready to act. Despite the quick sequence, the adrenaline-fueled car chase continues unabated. One of the individuals riding in the convertible brazenly pumps a shotgun, adding to the chaos of the pursuit. The lead police car swerves wildly and spins out of control, causing the second police vehicle to collide into it. In an attempt to avoid the pile-up, the third police car swerves sharply, catapulting into the air and hurtling towards a cluster of bystanders. Miraculously, it halts, suspended above them as if caught by an unseen force. The onlookers below, who have instinctively ducked in fear, glance up anxiously at the squad car seemingly frozen in midair. It is ensnared in a web, intricately spun by none other than Spider-Man, who swings into view just in time. In a daring maneuver, Spider-Man slips agilely between the cab and the trailer of a truck in his relentless pursuit of the convertible. Spider-Man soars through the air, diving and weaving expertly to evade the hail of bullets being pumped directly at him. With precision, he fires off two web pulls, landing deftly on the car's boot. Swiftly and skillfully, he ensnares the men's weapons within their own hands, tossing them effortlessly over an overhead light, with the men still comically attached. Inside a theater, MJ stands on stage, her eyes falling on Peter's conspicuously empty seat. Shortly after, Peter, driving the convertible, screeches to an abrupt stop outside the theater. He exits the vehicle and strides confidently into the theater. Peter pauses momentarily to tie his shoelace, all under the watchful eye of the usher. Upon straightening up, Peter's tie has gone awry, prompting the usher, dressed neatly in a waistcoat and dicky bow, to point discreetly at his tie, indicating the need for adjustment. Obliging, Peter tidies his necktie before producing his ticket. The usher, arms folded, maintains a stern demeanor as Peter makes his way toward the door, only to turn back upon remembering something. The usher gestures, miming a motion of locking his mouth, a silent request for quiet. Peter glances at his ticket, glaring at the usher with mild irritation. Later, Peter finds himself seated forlornly on a stoop facing the theater. A street musician plays nearby, her music filling the air. Peter watches her performance for a moment, then closes his eyes, shaking his head in disbelief. Stepping forward, he watches with hopeful anticipation. As if on cue, MJ emerges through the stage door with a feminine companion following closely behind her. Peter's face lights up with contentment, his smile wide and genuine. However, his expression fades as he observes an unknown man sharing a kiss with MJ. Distracted, Peter watches as a police car speeds by, followed closely by several others, before his attention is drawn back to the sight of MJ. He casts his eyes down, overwhelmed by sadness, and begins to move away. MJ and her companion walk away, arm-in-arm. She glances briefly over her shoulder, perhaps expecting to see Peter, but finds nothing but an empty space. Later, Peter finds himself entering a steam-filled backstreet. He breaks into a swift run, tearing open his shirt to reveal the iconic Spider-Man costume beneath. With a fluid motion, he dons the red mask, leaps into the air, and casts a web line to propel himself upward with determination. In a subsequent scene, a fleet of squad cars weaves its way through the wide expanse of a bustling city street. Above them, Spider-Man swings effortlessly from building to building, a striking figure against the urban skyline. Mid-swing, he flicks his wrists, gracefully falling ten stories and landing on a metallic surface with an audible thud. He hauls himself up from the now dented pipe, the impact evident. With a quick motion, he removes his Spider-Man mask and turns his attention to his wrist, examining it closely for any signs of injury.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
In a heart-pounding and adrenaline-fueled sequence of events, a sleek, eye-catching convertible smashes forcefully into a pursuing police car positioned right alongside it. Without pausing for even a moment, the convertible sets its determined course directly towards Peter. Demonstrating remarkable agility and athleticism, Peter leaps dramatically into the air, soaring gracefully over the convertible's sleek frame and executing a flawless, backwards somersault before landing expertly on his feet, composed and ready to act. Despite the quick succession of these breathtaking moments, the high-octane car chase continues unabated, with the intensity escalating further. One of the individuals riding in the convertible brazenly pumps a shotgun, adding yet another layer to the chaos of the wild pursuit. The lead police car swerves wildly, losing control and spinning out, which causes the second police vehicle to collide directly into it. In an attempt to avoid this sudden pile-up, the third police car swerves sharply, catapulting unexpectedly into the air and hurtling towards a nearby cluster of bystanders. Miraculously, it halts mid-flight, suspended above them as if caught by an unseen force. The onlookers below, who have instinctively ducked in fear and panic, glance up anxiously at the squad car, which appears to be frozen in midair. It is, in fact, ensnared in a web intricately spun by none other than Spider-Man, who swings into view at just the right moment. In a daring maneuver, Spider-Man slips agilely between the cab and the trailer of a truck in his relentless pursuit of the convertible. Spider-Man soars through the air, diving and weaving expertly to evade the hail of bullets being pumped directly at him. With precision, he fires off two web pulls, landing deftly on the car's boot. Swiftly and skillfully, he ensnares the men's weapons within their own hands, tossing them effortlessly over an overhead light, with the men still comically attached.

Inside a grand theater, MJ stands prominently on stage, her eyes falling on Peter's conspicuously empty seat in the audience. Shortly thereafter, Peter, driving the convertible, screeches to an abrupt halt just outside the entrance to the theater. Exiting the vehicle with purpose, he strides confidently into the theater's elegant interior. Peter pauses momentarily in the foyer to tie his shoelace, all under the watchful eye of the usher. Upon straightening up, Peter's tie has gone slightly awry, prompting the usher, dressed neatly in a waistcoat and dicky bow, to point discreetly at his tie, indicating the need for adjustment. Obliging, Peter straightens and tidies his necktie before producing his ticket. The usher, arms folded sternly, maintains a composed and serious demeanor as Peter makes his way toward the door, only to turn back, recalling something important he had momentarily forgotten. The usher gestures, miming a motion of locking his mouth, a silent, polite request for quiet. Peter glances at his ticket, casting a glance of mild irritation in the usher's direction. 

Later, Peter finds himself seated forlornly on a stoop facing the theater. A street musician plays nearby, the soft strains of her music gently filling the air. Peter watches her performance for a moment, then closes his eyes, shaking his head in disbelief. Stepping forward, he watches with hopeful anticipation. As if on cue, MJ emerges through the stage door with a feminine companion following closely behind her. Peter's face lights up suddenly with contentment, his smile wide and genuine at the sight. However, his joyful expression fades as he observes an unknown man sharing a kiss with MJ. Distracted, Peter watches as a police car speeds by, followed closely by several others, before his attention is drawn back to the sight of MJ. He casts his eyes downward, overwhelmed by sadness, and begins to move away. MJ and her companion walk away, arm-in-arm, with MJ glancing briefly over her shoulder, perhaps expecting to see Peter, but finding nothing more than an empty space. 

Later, Peter finds himself entering a steam-filled backstreet. He breaks into a swift, determined run, tearing open his shirt to reveal the iconic red-and-blue Spider-Man costume beneath. With a fluid, practiced motion, he dons the red mask, leaps powerfully into the air, and casts a web line to propel himself upward with unwavering determination. In a subsequent scene, a fleet of squad cars weaves its way through the wide expanse of a bustling city street. Above them, Spider-Man swings effortlessly from building to building, a striking figure silhouetted against the urban skyline. Mid-swing, he flicks his wrists, gracefully falling ten stories and landing on a metallic surface with an audible thud. He hauls himself up from the now dented pipe, the impact evident. With a quick motion, he removes his Spider-Man mask and turns his attention to his wrist, examining it closely for any signs of injury or discomfort.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A convertible races wildly, smashing violently into the side of a police car that is closing in to give chase, then abruptly veers with reckless determination straight for Peter. Instinctively, Peter propels himself into the air, his body arching gracefully as he performs a precise backwards somersault over the speeding convertible, and lands with deft poise. The chaotic car chase shows no signs of abating. One of the occupants within the convertible, filled with adrenaline, methodically pumps a shotgun in preparation. In a desperate maneuver, the leading police car spins wildly, its tires screeching, while the second police car crashes into it with a loud, destructive impact. The third police car, in a desperate attempt to avoid the mangled wreckage, swerves sharply, causing it to catapult into the air, tumbling ominously towards a cluster of bystanders. Suspense grips the air as the squad car halts abruptly, suspended above the terrified onlookers, who shield their eyes, mesmerized by the sight of the vehicle hanging mystically in midair, entangled in an intricate web. At that precise moment, Spider-Man swings past with agile finesse. As the chase intensifies, Spider-Man adroitly navigates between the cab and trailer of a large truck, seamlessly pursuing the convertible. With remarkable agility, he soars through the air, diving and weaving with precision to elude the shower of bullets directed at him. In a fluid motion, he skillfully fires two web pulls, then lands steadily on the car's boot. With quick reflexes, he ensnares the assailants' weapons still clenched in their hands, hoisting them over an overhead light, leaving the men awkwardly dangling. Back at the theater, MJ stands on stage, her gaze fixed on the empty seat where Peter should be. Meanwhile, Peter screeches to a halt at the theater's entrance in the convertible, hastily exits the car, and strides purposefully inside. Interrupting his steps, he bends to tie his shoelace, his actions observed intently by the usher nearby, before standing upright again. Noticing his tie askew, the usher, dressed in a formal waistcoat and dicky bow, discreetly gestures toward Peter's crooked necktie. Peter awkwardly straightens it, then advances, producing his ticket with a hint of embarrassment. The usher, unimpressed, folds his arms in silent reproach. Peter hesitates at the door, glancing back at the usher, who cryptically gestures as though locking his mouth. Confused, Peter examines his ticket and, with a mixture of frustration and bewilderment, glares at the usher, feeling thwarted. Resigned, Peter finds himself sitting on a stoop across from the theater, lost in his thoughts. A nearby street musician plays a soft tune, and Peter's gaze falls upon her, momentarily absorbed in the melody, before he closes his eyes, shaking his head incredulously at the turn of events. He steps forward, watching the scene unfold with expectant eyes. Suddenly, MJ emerges through the stage door, followed closely by another girl. A contented smile spreads across Peter's face, only to falter when he spots a man kissing MJ affectionately. His expression transforms as he witnesses a police car zoom past, trailed by several others, capturing his attention briefly before it returns to MJ. Saddened, he bows his head and begins to move away. MJ and her companion stroll off affectionately, arm in arm, and as they do, MJ casts a brief glance over her shoulder, as if hoping to catch sight of Peter, only to find an empty space. Peter, with a sense of urgency, enters a steam-filled alleyway, breaking into a determined run. With an emphatic motion, he tears open his shirt, revealing the iconic Spider-Man costume beneath. Resolutely, he pulls on the vibrant red mask, launching himself into the air and casting a web line to expertly propel himself upward. In a short while, a group of squad cars snakes its way down a wide city street. Above them, Spider-Man, gracefully suspended, swings elegantly from one towering building to the next. Mid-swing, he deftly flicks his wrists, releasing the web line to descend swiftly, plummeting ten stories before landing with a metallic thud. He hauls himself up, dusting off the now dented metal pipe, and as he does, he removes his Spider-Man mask, examining his wrist with contemplative focus.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
A convertible crashes into a police car during a chase and speeds toward Peter, who leaps over the vehicle with a backward somersault, landing gracefully. One of the convertible’s occupants loads a shotgun as the leading police car spins out, causing a chain reaction. The third car catapults into the air, stopping mid-fall above bystanders, suspended in Spider-Man's web. Spider-Man swings past, weaving expertly between obstacles and gunfire, firing web pulls to land on the convertible. He ensnares the men’s weapons, tossing them with the men still attached over an overhead light.

Meanwhile, MJ notices Peter’s empty seat on stage. Peter drives the convertible to the theater, adjusts his crooked tie, and presents his ticket, but the usher silently indicates there’s a problem. Peter steps outside, bewildered, and sits across from the theater. A street musician plays nearby. MJ exits with another girl, followed by a man who kisses her, causing Peter's smile to fade. He watches police cars speed by, then looks back at MJ, ultimately moving away as she walks off with her date. MJ briefly looks around for Peter but doesn’t see him.

Peter enters a steam-filled alley, swiftly transforms into Spider-Man, and swings into action, casting a web line upward. Later, as squad cars navigate a city street, Spider-Man swings above them, flicking his wrists mid-swing. He falls 10 stories, landing on a metal pipe, examines his wrist after removing his Spider-Man mask.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A convertible, a type of car known for its retractable roof, smashes into a chasing police car. This pursuit takes place in a bustling city, known for its high-speed chases and urban chaos. The convertible, maneuvering aggressively, is drawn alongside, then heads straight for Peter, who is known for his quick reflexes and agility. Peter leaps in the air over the convertible, showcasing his acrobatics, completes a backwards somersault, and lands, poised like a trained gymnast. The car chase is still on, with tensions mounting. One of the guys in the convertible, wielding a shotgun, pumps the weapon with a menacing air. The leading police car spins as if in a high-stakes movie scene. The second squad car hits it with a crunching impact. The third swerves to avoid it in a desperate maneuver. It catapults into the air like a scene from a stunt show and drops towards a group of bystanders, who are captivated by the unfolding drama. It stops, suspended above them almost miraculously. Cowering, they all look closely at the squad car, which is seemingly hanging in midair, caught in a web spun by the city’s masked hero. Spider-Man swings past, a symbol of hope amid chaos. Spider-Man, known for his dexterity, slips between the cab and trailer of a truck as he pursues the convertible, determined to stop the criminals. Spider-Man soars through the city skyline, dives, and weaves with expertise to avoid the bullets being pumped directly at him. He fires two web pulls with precision. He lands on the car's boot, a testament to his agility. He ensnares the men's weapons in their hands with his webbing, a feat of strength and precision, and tosses them over an overhead light, with the men still attached, ensuring their capture. On stage, MJ, a talented actress engaged in a live theatrical performance, stares at Peter's empty seat, noticing his absence. Peter screeches up to the theater in the convertible, making a grand entrance. Peter leaves the car, eager to see the show, then enters the theater. Peter bends down to tie his shoelace, a mundane task, watched by the usher, then straightens up. His tie is crooked and out of place, causing a moment of embarrassment. The usher, wearing a traditional waistcoat and dicky bow, points to his tie, adhering to theater protocols. Peter straightens his necktie, then steps forward, trying to make a better impression. He produces the ticket, feeling the pressure of the usher's scrutiny. The usher folds his arms, unimpressed. Peter walks to the door, then turns back, feeling the weight of the usher's judgment. The usher gestures, locking his mouth, indicating silence is required. Peter looks at his ticket, wondering if he made a mistake, and glares at him, feeling frustration well up. Peter sits on a stoop opposite the theater, reflecting on his evening. A nearby street musician, a regular fixture in this vibrant part of town, plays tunes that echo in the night. Peter watches her, then closes his eyes and shakes his head incredulously. He steps forward, watching expectantly as if searching for answers. MJ comes out through the stage door, her performance concluded. A girl comes out after her, engaged in conversation. Peter smiles contentedly, momentarily hopeful. Peter's smile fades as he sees the guy, who appears to be MJ's new partner, kissing MJ, shattering his optimism. Peter watches a police car fly past, flashing its lights, followed by a few more, adding to the night's intensity. His attention returns to MJ, his feelings raw. Then he looks down sadly and moves off, feeling a sense of loss. MJ and her man walk off, arm-in-arm, seemingly happy. MJ looks around briefly as if expecting to see Peter, but there's nobody there, leaving an air of wistfulness. Peter enters a steam-filled backstreet, reminiscent of New York's gritty alleys. He breaks into a run, fueled by determination, then tears open his shirt to reveal the Spider-Man costume, a symbol of his dual life. He pulls on the red mask, embracing his heroic identity, leaps into the air with a burst of energy, casting a web line to pull himself up, ready to swing back into action. Later, a group of squad cars weave their way down a wide city street, part of the relentless city life. Above them, Spider-Man swings from building to building with agility and grace. Hanging mid-swing, he flicks his wrists, executing his iconic moves. He falls 10 stories, calculating his descent, landing on some metal with a resonant thud. He hauls himself up from the now dented pipe, assessing the situation. He takes off his Spider-Man mask, revealing the face of a young man carrying the weight of duty, and examines his wrist, ensuring he is uninjured before he continues his vigil.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: A convertible smashes into a chasing police car which is drawn alongside then heads straight for Peter. Peter leaps in the air over the convertible completes a backwards somersault and lands poised. The car chase is still on. One of the guys in the convertible pumps a shotgun. The leading police car spins. The second hits it. The third swerves to avoid it. It catapults into the air and drops towards a group of bystanders. It stops suspended above them. Cowering they all look closely at the squad car seemingly hanging in midair. It is caught in a web. SpiderMan swings past. SpiderMan slips between the cab and trailer of a truck as he pursues the convertible. SpiderMan soars dives and weaves to avoid the bullets being pumped directly at him. He fires two web pulls. He lands on the car's boot. He ensnares the men's weapons in their hands and tosses them over an overhead light the men still attached. On stage. MJ stares at Peter's empty seat. Peter screeches up to the theater in the convertible. Peter leaves the car then enters the theater. Peter bends down to tie his shoelace watched by the usher then straightens up. His tie is crooked. The usher in a waistcoat and dicky bow points to his tie. Peter straightens his necktie then steps forward. He produces the ticket. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. The usher folds his arms. Peter walks to the door then turns back. The usher gestures locking his mouth. Peter looks at his ticket and glares at him. Peter sits on a stoop opposite the theater. A nearby street musician plays. Peter watches her then closes his eyes and shakes his head incredulously. He steps forward watching expectantly. MJ comes out through the stage door. A girl comes out after her. Peter smiles contentedly. Peter's smile fades as he sees the guy kissing MJ. Peter watches a police car fly past followed by a few more. His attention returns to MJ. Then he looks down sadly and moves off. MJ and her man walk off arminarm. MJ looks around briefly as if expecting to see Peter but there is nobody there. Peter enters a steamfilled backstreet. He breaks into a run then tears open his shirt to reveal the SpiderMan costume. He pulls on the red mask leaps into the air casting a web line to pull himself up. Later a group of squad cars weave their way down a wide city street. Above them. SpiderMan swings from building to building. Hanging midswing he flicks his wrists. He falls 10 stories landing on some metal. He hauls himself up from the now dented pipe. He takes off his SpiderMan mask and examines his wrist.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: A convertible smashes into a chasing police car which is drawn alongside then heads straight for Peter. Peter leaps in the air over the convertible completes a backwards somersault and lands poised. The car chase is still on. One of the guys in the convertible pumps a shotgun. The leading police car spins. The second hits it. The third swerves to avoid it. It catapults into the air and drops towards a group of bystanders. It stops suspended above them. Cowering they all look closely at the squad car seemingly hanging in midair. It is caught in a web. SpiderMan swings past. SpiderMan slips between the cab and trailer of a truck as he pursues the convertible. SpiderMan soars dives and weaves to avoid the bullets being pumped directly at him. He fires two web pulls. He lands on the car's boot. He ensnares the men's weapons in their hands and tosses them over an overhead light the men still attached. On stage. MJ stares at Peter's empty seat. Peter screeches up to the theater in the convertible. Peter leaves the car then enters the theater. Peter bends down to tie his shoelace watched by the usher then straightens up. His tie is crooked. The usher in a waistcoat and dicky bow points to his tie. Peter straightens his necktie then steps forward. He produces the ticket. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A pineapple collides with a pursuing hot air balloon, which is painted alongside, then floats directly toward Amelia. Amelia hops on the seesaw over the pineapple, completes a forward handspring, and rests, balanced. The hot air balloon race is still on. One of the ducks in the pineapple inflates a rubber raft. The trailing blimp twirls. The second nudges it. The third veers to bypass it. It cannonballs into the sky and descends toward a herd of jellyfish. It pauses, levitating below them. Shivering, they all peer attentively at the zeppelin seemingly hovering in the atmosphere. It's trapped in a net. Batgirl zips past. Batgirl slides between the canoe and paddle of a kayak as she chases the pineapple. Batgirl glides, plunges, and zigzags to dodge the snowflakes being tossed directly at her. She shoots three cable tosses. She lands on the pineapple's trunk. She entangles the penguins' umbrellas in their flippers and flings them around a traffic cone, the penguins still fastened. On a hill, Lily gazes at Amelia's vacant blanket. Amelia drifts up to the meadow in the pineapple. Amelia exits the pineapple, then skips into the meadow. Amelia stoops to adjust her sandal, observed by the gardener, then stands up. Her hat is tilted. The gardener in coveralls and a wide-brimmed sunhat points to her hat. Amelia aligns her bonnet, then advances. She reveals the picnic basket. The gardener folds her hands. Amelia ambles to the fence, then spins around. The gardener signals, zipping her backpack. Amelia gazes at her basket and scowls at her. Amelia rests on a bench across from the meadow. A passing minstrel sings. Amelia observes him, then closes her eyes and nods disbelievingly. She advances, watching eagerly. Lily exits through the garden gate. A parrot flies out after her. Amelia grins cheerfully. Amelia's grin diminishes as she notices the bird embracing Lily. Amelia observes a submarine drift past, followed by a couple more. Her focus redirects to Lily. Then she glances downward sorrowfully and wanders away. Lily and her hummingbird stroll away, wing-in-wing. Lily glances around fleetingly as if anticipating to see Amelia, but there's nobody present. Amelia enters a foggy alley. She dashes into a sprint, then tears open her poncho to reveal the Batgirl outfit. She pulls on the blue cowl, bounces into the sky, tossing a cord line to elevate herself. Later, a fleet of firetrucks zigzag their course down a narrow country lane. Above them, Batgirl zips from tree to tree. Hanging mid-zip, she snaps her fingers. She plummets 10 meters, landing on some wood. She heaves herself up from the now dented beam. She pulls off her Batgirl cowl and scrutinizes her ankle.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A convertible crashes into a police car, narrowly missing Peter. Peter leaps over it with a somersault. The car chase intensifies as Spider-Man intervenes, saving civilians by suspending a police car in his web. He skillfully dodges gunfire, ensnares the criminals, and leaves them hanging from an overhead light. Meanwhile, MJ notices Peter's empty theater seat. Peter, arriving late in the convertible, fixes his tie and presents his ticket to the usher. He sits outside, watching a musician, until MJ exits with another man, kissing him, leaving Peter disheartened. He enters a backstreet, dons his Spider-Man suit, and swings through the city. Spider-Man lands on a metal pipe, examines his wrist, then continues his mission.
